Caio Ribeiro

Caio Ribeiro is a native of Brazil. Caio's first short film, Ballad for Two Lovers, won the best director's award at the Brussels Film Festival in Belgium in 1999.
Caio's first feature film, Sometime in August, was named an official selection at the Los Angeles Independent Film Festival, the Florida Independent Film Festival, and nominated for the best American independent film of 1999.

From 1999 to 2004, Caio wrote and served as director of photography for two World War II films, Last Letters from Monte Rosa and
The Fallen.
Both films were winners of multiple awards and distributed internationally. In 2007 Caio started working on The Realm, a series that pays homage to The Twilight Zone.

Caio is currently working on a three part project:

I - A full length documentary about Jorge Luis Borges' story "The Intruder", and its hidden symbols, that reveals a Borges unknown to the general public.

II - An Interactive Installation,
"Borges Obscurus", where players create alternate versions of "The Intruder", from the point of view of Juliana Burgos, a character Borges named after himself, but who he refuses to give a voice in the story.

III - A full length ballet of "The Intruder" that will premiere in the National Library of Buenos Aires, and subsequently travel to libraries around the world.

"I was swept away by the sheer poetry, by the pacing, by the profundity of the filmmaker's thoughts, and the sublime acting."

The New York Post

The Realm

A growing number of reports suggest some people who go through extreme trauma develop the ability to tap into the memories of others who have gone through similar life changing events.

The Carrier of Time

A controversial thinker wants to take the world by storm with his theory of might is right, only to watch his personal world burn to ashes, and having to rebuild his life alongside the powerless and rejected.

Where Or When

Juliette begs her husband for a baby before he dies of brain cancer. Greg agrees under the condition that Juliette finds a new dad for the baby. Juliette is in for a surprise when she realizes that miraculously she is able to transfer her husband's disease to the new man. Can she go through and sacrifice an innocent man, to save her true love?

Guilty As Charged

In the emergency room of a hospital, a hit man lies dying while reconstructing the events that led to his demise through the memories of his nemesis, who lies mortally wounded by his side.

Wake Up In New York

After been released from a mental institution a young woman tries to put her life back together. Little she knows she is bound to relieve the events that drove her mad.

Borges Obscurus

Introduction

Borges Obscurus is an interactive installation where audiences uncover Juliana Burgos' untold version of Jorge Luis Borges's "The Intruder".

In Borges' story "The Intruder", the intruder herself is Juliana Burgos, a young edge of town woman two hoodlum brothers fall in love with. At the end, Juliana is murdered by the brothers themselves, in their desperate attempt not to fall into the tempation of killing one another instead.

In the Borges Obscurus version of "The Intruder", audiences are given the chance to choose Juliana's ending.

Physical Aspect of the Installation

Borges Obscurus is a room size replica of the pedestal of the bust of Borges by the Argentinian sculptor Noelia Gil.

Interactive Space

A soft ambient light brings Borges Obscurus out of darkness, revealing the inside of Juliana's bedroom. A three mirror vanity rests against one of the walls. The player sits at the vanity:

In the middle mirror his/her reflection is transformed into that of Juliana's, reflecting the present. The left mirror reflects the past. The right mirror reflects the furture.

Theme

The player, now Juliana, finds him/herself in the middle of her story, trying to sort out past events, and watching the future unfold, simultaneously.

The player is limited to experience the events from Juliana's own subjective perspective. Whatever prop the player interacts with reveals a set of events involving the use of that prop in the story. As the events unfold Juliana becomes aware of the dynamics between her relationship with each brother as well as the relationship between the brothers themselves.
